Job Description: I. Job Purpose To provide technical work by performing stress analysis, piping specifications, and engineering specifications while ensuring conformance to all Codes and procedures related to engineering functions, labor and systems reporting; and active interface with the project team, vendors, and clients. II .Key Outputs Provide technical interface for piping analysis work, and interfaces with structural engineering, piping design, and support design groups, in the design of piping systems and pipe supporting elements; Prepare analytical reports determining the reactions of piping on equipment and structures; Interpret and apply code requirements; Review proposed piping support systems, identify issues, and recommend appropriate, cost-effective solutions; Interface and exchanges engineering details between external contacts including equipment suppliers, clients, and installation contractors; Consult with client and others on field-related issues including follow-up reports or design modifications; Coordinate with other engineers, project managers, client personnel, and suppliers to ensure a complete and timely design; Provide thorough investigation for project requirements including safety and environmental compliance issues and technical review of piping stress and material needs; III. Minimum Qualifications 1. Education BS Mechanical Engineering, BS Civil Engineering, or Engineering Mechanics 2. Experience Two (02) years creating computer piping analysis models and interpreting results for code compliance. 3. Skills and Knowledge Committed to quality, responsibility, and high work standard; knowledge of piping discipline and general knowledge of other disciplines; Knowledge of the design, selection, and application of pipe supporting elements; Solid understanding of developing piping specifications and/or performing stress analysis on complex piping systems; Solid understanding of internal economic factors affecting assignment areas (costs, margins, profit impact of decisions); 4. Behavioral/Physical Committed to quality, responsibility, high work standards, and initiatives; Ability to independently organize and give priority to work assignments and coordinate a variety of tasks; With good attention to details and ability to deal with conflicting priorities and deadlines. 5. Technical Must have knowledge of ASME B31.1 and ASME B&PV Section III piping codes (knowledge of B31.1 1967 Edition and B&PV Section III 1971 through Summer 1973 Addenda is preferred); The ability to navigate a 3D CAD model; Experience with CAESAR II Pipe Stress Analysis software; Knowledge of gas dynamics and hydraulic transients is desirable; Knowledge of pipe condition assessment is a plus; Must be proficient in use of Database systems related to Engineering functions.

Responsibilities: • Responsible for providing technical support, consultation and on-site/remote diagnostics on products/systems, including DeltaV DCS, DeltaV SIS (Safety Instrumented Systems), AMS Device Manager, Wireless Solution and PlantWeb installations for systems in Asia Pacific, Europe, Middle East, Africa, North America and Latin America end-user customers and engineering organizations. This involves troubleshooting, problem analysis and solutions generation to hardware, software, installation, configuration, integration, and application issues and inquiries. Maintains ownership of all received customer problems, provides timely updates, and sets the appropriate escalation priority. • Successfully works to identify workarounds, reduce product problem resolution time, and support efforts to develop training and troubleshooting resources (e.g. procedures, diagnostics, and documentation) • Collaborates with Local Business Partners and Field Service Organizations worldwide, Technology, Marketing and Manufacturing to resolve product problems and plot product design directions at a local and global level Qualifications Requirements: • BS/MS in Chemical, Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical, Instrumentation, or other Engineering Degrees • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in process control or process engineering in at least one of the following process industries: hydrocarbon processing, oil and gas (onshore/offshore), pulp and paper, specialty chemicals, pharmaceutical, food and beverage, power generation. • Responsible for control system configuration, third-party equipment integration, startup of process control projects, or on-going system maintenance/support • Experience with DCS, PLC, or SCADA systems. Understanding of discrete, continuous, or batch controls; PC based HMI, Advanced Controls, Fieldbus or field instrumentation. Knowledge of networking, TCP/IP, and Windows operating system. • Ability to troubleshoot systems and to present clear and concise information to the team, internal customers, and external customers Alternate Work Setup - WFH/Onsite if required (Ortigas, Pasig) Shifting schedule For faster process, you may send resume to [email protected]

Job Summary We are looking for a technical writer to develop detailed installation and user documentation for a diverse set of software products. You will work with product developers and members of the technical documentation team to develop content that will enable our customers to successfully install, set up, and use our products. Job Role Develop, write, and support end-user documentation that includes high-level technical content, reference material, and detailed, task-specific work instructions. Work with product developers, subject matter experts, product marketing managers and members of the technical documentation team to develop technical content that enables our customers to successfully install, set up, and use our products. Write end-user documentation for a multi-disciplined and multi-cultural audience, including process control operators, control systems engineers, configuration engineers, and others. Work in DITA CMS to write new documentation and maintain existing documentation. Comply with best practices established by the company on writing style, format, and content. Explore complex technical products and provide technically accurate and audience-focused documents for new and existing functionality in software and hardware. Be responsible for driving the review and approval of technical content within the document management system. Qualifications BS/MS in Chemical, Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical, Instrumentation, or other Engineering Degrees With 2 to 4 years work related experience Experience with modular documentation (for example, DITA XML) and component content management systems Desire to seek continuous improvements and innovation Experience in using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint Demonstrated internships in technical writing/information development

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Job Objectives To assist the Terminal Manager on the day to day Tank Truck Loading Rack operations while ensuring safety and efficient receiving and loading transactions with proper documentations. Position shall be responsible for the implementation of the safety regulations and operations of Wharf safely and efficiently. This includes coordination with various tenant users and supply group for the timely and orderly scheduling of vessel dockings. INVENTORY MANAGEMENT 1. Reviews and checks Daily Stock Report of assigned terminal.2. Monitors receiving of incoming and transferred products in all ports.3. Reports any untoward incident & discrepancies of incoming products to Terminal Manager and submits all documents needed to be given to Trade and Supply for their protest to suppliers and/or haulers.4. Importation receiving acting as Loading Master.5. Holds barge/ trucks, prepares protest documents, for those with incoming or dispatching problem. Reports incident to Terminal Manager for consensus recommendation/ decision as well as corresponding and applicable charges.6. Reports, analyses and initiates necessary courses of actions in relation to inventory losses.7. Reviews and approves point to point analysis for all incoming products by barge and vessel from importation.8. Checks and monitors the accomplishment of Tank Movement Report (TMR) and ensures timely submission to relevant departments for recording and analysis of sales, dispatch and incoming.9. Submits Weekly Terminal Highlights every Monday to Compliance Officer. WHARF MANAGEMENT 1. Clears import and domestic vessels for docking.2. Coordinates with tenant users and Supply Department for the orderly scheduling of vessel dockings.3. Coordinates with the service providers the provision of tugs and moorings for domestic vessel docking.4. Coordinates, liaise and represent with matters related to PPA that would affect the operations of pier. This includes new regulation and permit requirements.5. Coordinates, liaise and represent with various government agencies such as police and army intelligence groups for various security cooperation related to pier operations.6. Manages the manpower requirements of pier operations to ensure that enough personnel are on hand in each and every vessel loading and receiving.7. Responsible for the safe, orderly and efficient use of all pier assets including its repairs and maintenance, cleanliness and safe operation.8. Approves all billings for terminal charges for both import and domestic vessel dockings.9. Develops and implements monitoring procedures for the tenants’ inventories, including its gains and losses.10. Develops and maintains monitoring templates of all billings made to all vessels docking at Terminal including its timely collections and remittances to Treasury Department.11. Manages and approves all vessel boarding and disembarkation requests from agents which may include sire inspection, audits, personnel singing on and off and shore leaves and chandling. Coordinates with vessel officials to ensure that crew complies with the terminal safety regulations during shore leave availment.

I. Job Purpose The Designer develops detailed design drawings for the CSA scope of a project. Designer will be expected to coordinate with the CSA Lead Engineer and other disciplines in order to complete the deliverables within schedule, budget and quality expected by Ambitech and/or the client. II. Key Outputs 1. Detailed Design Drawings Uses company approved software to draw two-dimensional (2D) engineering drawings for client approval and/or construction, in coordination with the Lead Engineer and within the specifications required by Ambitech and/or client; Ensures the three-dimensional (3D) model and 2D drawings match perfectly; Follows Ambitech quality procedures, including proper checking, filing and submission of deliverables; Applies designer knowledge (steel framing, steel connection and concrete rebar detailing, etc.) in creating the deliverables; Takes accountability for the overall presentation of the drawings, such as adhering to the company’s or the client’s drafting standards, and understanding the level of detail required to clearly communicate the intended design; 2. 3D Modelling Uses company approved software to create 3D models of the structure, foundation, and other required details; Performs clash checking between the CSA model and other discipline’s model; Provides solutions or options for complex design related issues. 3. Others Tasks Field Assignments: Occasionally, the Designer is tasked to visit the project site to take measurements, pictures and other information; CSA Department Initiatives: The Designer is expected to participate in other tasks that support the objectives of the department and the company as assigned by the Department Lead. III. Minimum Qualifications 1. Education Post-Secondary Non-Tertiary/Technical-Vocational Education (Vocational) or Tertiary/Baccalaureate (College) education, preferably related to Architectural or Civil Engineering fields, or equivalent. 2. Experience Experience in civil and structural design is desired, specifically in industrial and petrochemical facilities. 3. Skills and Knowledge Proficient in AutoCAD Knowledge in other drawing and modelling software (Cadworx, PDMS, Microstation, Autoplant, Revit, etc.) is a plus. 4. Behavioral/Physical Must be organized, self-directed, able to prioritize and multi-task, work in a team environment and take direction from others; Willing to learn and work on a variety of tasks within multiple industries; Able to communicate in person, phone, email or video conferences; Available for site visits requiring mobility; Detail oriented and with a quality mindset. 5. Technical Ability to visualize 3D drawings and drawings with view depths; understanding and visualization of section views, isometric and orthographic projections; Aptitude to produce 3D models from 2D drawings, and 2D drawings from 3D models; Familiarity with engineering areas such as connection and weld detailing, and reinforcing bar detailing, for steel and concrete construction, respectively, is a plus; Knowledge of basic calculations such as for areas and volumes. SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE EXTENDED COMPETITIVE JOB OFFERS COMMENSURATE THEIR JOB-RELATED COMPETENCIES AND EXPERIENCES.

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Petroleum/Oil/Gas) or equivalent. At least 6 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor / 5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Oil/Gas or equivalent. With BOSH training is an advantage. Computer literate. Knowledgeable in SAP. Experience in petroleum industry is an advantage. With own motorcycle and with valid driver's license. Full-Time position(s) available. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INVENTORY MANAGEMENT1. Maintains updated inventory records at all times.2. Checks Tank Movement Report (TMR) being accomplished by Operations Assistants then submits to Terminal Manager. Validates all figures such as volume received, dispatched, transferred, tank level, gains and losses in the TMR vs. Tank Sounding Logbook as reported and recorded by the Operations Assistants.3. Prepares Receiving Reports of all incoming products in the terminal by encoding all necessary information in SAP.4. Reports 6am/8am stock level in all tanks of the terminal to Stock Control Analyst for inclusion in the Daily Stock Report.5. Oversees incoming/outgoing barge/vessel discharging/loading operation while ensuring safety measures and standard operating procedures are observed, and documentations are carried out.6. Conducts and reports regular inventory of Additives and Dyes as advised by the immediate superior.7. Receives non-trade operating materials needed in the Stock Control operational activities during his/her shift.8. Consolidates and prepares other transactions such as Product Loan, affiliates withdrawal, terminalling, backloads, diversion, downgrades, product transfers and reports to his/her superior and assists in the accomplishment of monthly Summary Report with all the necessary and appropriate document forms.9. Regularly conducts inventory of storage and handling equipment such as petroleum hose, sampling bottles, drums, pails etc. ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS1. Recommends approval and monitors leave of absences of subordinates.2. Transmits respective depot Receiving Reports after checking and signed by the Terminal Manager.3. Checks and reviews Disport Documents prepared by the Operations Assistant during and prior to the release of barge/vessel after discharging operation. Gives feedback to the Terminal Manager/SC Officer on the barge's/vessel's outturn prior to release and prepares the initial Four (4) Point Analysis.4. Coordinates with Stock Control Analyst in the monitoring of Vessel/Barge shipment voyage in the information regarding the latter's Expected Time of Arrival at nominated discharge Port.5. Secures clearance from the terminal office for the berthing of the vessel/barge and coordinate with and inform Safety and Logistics department to plan and adjust any related operations/transactions that may be affected with the receiving of the cargo.6. Ensures all units to have their respective Shift turn-over and all process are securely documented and any pending deliverables be monitored.7. Does actual supervision of depot operations from time to time.8. Reacts to emergency situations when they occur, coordinate immediately with safety, assess the situation, declare emergency, take corrective actions, shut down the depot totally or partially and coordinates related fire-fighting actions with fire team.9. Initiates request for any necessary plan equipment maintenance and repair to maintain the plant in good working condition. REPORTS, DOCUMENTATIONS AND ANALYSIS 1. Losses Computation for Barge / Vessel with significant losses and relay to the Terminal Manager. 2. Assists in the diagnosis of plant operational problems, inform Terminal manager for proper corrective actions. 3. Hold release of products of quality problems in consultation with the Terminal Manager and Quality Control/ Technical Head.

Job Title: Fuel Pump Operator - Southern Nergos, Valencia
Job Description: Job Duties: Monitors gauges and flow meters and inspects equipment to ensure that tank levels, temperatures, chemical amounts, and pressure are at specified levels, reporting abnormalities as necessary. Records operating data such as products and quantities pumped, stocks, used, gauging result, and operating times. Communicates with other workers, using signals, radios, or telephones, to start and stop flows of materials or substances. Turns valves and start pumps to start or regulate flows of substances such as gases, oils, and other liquid materials. Reads operating schedules or instructions or receives verbal orders, in order to determine amounts to be pumped. Check for leaks or malfunctions, and ensure that any such incidents are timely reported the supervisor. Conduct pump meter and dips reading in every shift. Ensure that the key is turn over before loading the vehicle for safety purposes. Clean and sanitized offices, restrooms, and remove garbage and ensure that no hazardous materials are present in or around the fuel facilities station. Comply with health, safety, security, and environment regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas. Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Vocational Diploma/Short Course Certificate, Bachelor's/College Degree in any field.At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.Preferably Less than 1 year experience specialized in Engineering - Oil/Gas or equivalent.Must have a safety trainingCan work with minimal supervision

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES Plan, schedule, supervise and ensure that all Gas Station Attendants & Cashiers adhere to store policies Responsible for maintain fuel and merchandise inventories Ensure the accuracy and safekeeping of all cash and non-cash sales Submit fuel orders in a timely fashion so fuel arrives before reserves run low Keep up on a daily reports from the Management to ensure prices reflect current economic trends. Knowledgeable with basic troubleshooting of the pumps Coach staff as necessary to improve delivery of customer service QUALIFICATIONS Graduate of any 4-year course With at least 1 year same working experience Must have good communication skills Results-driven Self-starter, organized, and detailed oriented With experience handling customers and personnel Willing to be assigned in Talon 5, Las Piñas City

Job Title: TERMINAL MANAGER (petroleum industry) for CEBU and DAVAO
Location: Central Visayas, Eastern Visayas, Davao, Western Visayas
Job Description: TERMINAL MANAGER FOR Cebu and Davao Depot SUMMARY STATEMENT: Assists in all terminal operations including administration, safety, maintenance, and production. RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: 1. Regularly conducts quality assessment of fuel and lubricant inventory forecasting of all the company’s retail, commercial and industrial consumers. 2. Monitors current practices/procedures as well as equipment at the terminal to ensure compliance with safety and environmental standards. 3. Monitors the quality and quantity of bulk transfers and prepares vessel documents after loading tankers/barges. 4. Ensures that the quality and quantity of the tank truck loading rack (TTLR) comply with the company-approved trade secret in the doping of color and additives. 5. Prepares reports required by the Department of Energy (DOE) and the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR). All reports should be submitted to the Operations Manager for approval prior submittal to the concerned government agencies. 6. Monitors and maintains daily, weekly, and monthly records of bulk operations to determine the terminal’s gains and losses. 7. Investigates unsafe practices, spillage, near misses, or other accidents observed at the terminal. These incidents will be reported to the Operations Manager and the Corporate Office. 8. Regularly assesses terminal operations to ensure safety practices and procedures are properly implemented. Any possible deficiency found at the terminal should be corrected immediately to reduce cases of preventive accidents. QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Candidate must possess a Bachelor's/College Degree in Mechanical Engineering 2. Must be a licensed Mechanical Engineer 3. At least 4-5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position, preferably in petroleum industry. 4. Must be willing to be assigned at any of the following locations: Cebu and Davao
